item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Director Talks Leon‚Äôs ‚ÄòRuthless Anger‚Äô
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem features a much older Leon Kennedy. As such, the ninth mainline entry into the long-running horror video game series is set to explore how his past adventures have changed him, and in this case, made him cold and angry towards the world.

The game‚Äôs director, Capcom‚Äôs Koshi Nakanishi, was recently interviewed by DenNicoFamiGamer. In the interview, Nakanishi notes that Leon‚Äôs years fighting the undead have made him more cynical about the world, saying he exudes a ‚Äúruthless anger.‚Äù

‚ÄúLeon is making a reappearance in this game, and this is the result of us digging deep into the idea of ‚Äòwhat type of person would Leon grow into? What would he be thinking?‚Äù Nakanishi says (h/t: Games Radar+).

Leon Has An Ax to Grind in Resident Evil Requiem

Furthermore, it‚Äôs noted that one key way Leon‚Äôs personality change is on display is in how he attacks the zombies. In the upcoming game, his main weapon will be an ax, which is said to symbolize how he has changed over the years.

Nakanishi says he wants players to question why Leon made this choice and why he is acting with such aggression and anger. He wants players to ponder what is wrong with the character they‚Äôve known for over two decades.

‚ÄúThis game‚Äôs Leon fights by swinging his bloody ax in a way where you might start thinking, ‚ÄòWhat‚Äôs wrong with you, Leon?‚Äô while playing. That is what we‚Äôre aiming for.‚Äù

Resident Evil Requiem will release on February 27 for PlayStation 5, PC, Nintendo Switch 2, and Xbox Series. Fans can learn more about the upcoming game here.

item.title: Fortnite Director Teases ‚ÄòFun Update‚Äô to ‚ÄòSpice Up‚Äô Current Season
item.content:encoded:
Ted Timmins, the design director of Fortnite, has commented on players‚Äô desires for new content, changes to the development team for the longstanding Battle Royale pillar, and teased some major updates to come in the next couple of months.

When a game reaches the level of success Fortnite has, listening to your audience is key. In the first season of its 7th chapter, Fortnite continues to draw interest through collaborations with popular IPs such as The Office. However, core gameplay will always be a focal point.

In a tweet, Ted Timmins, responding to a video from SypherPK, noted that he understands the community is seeking new content. He also stated that there was always an understood risk when focusing on battle Royale mode and going back to basics with the first season of Chapter 7.

He then teased a fun update coming in February, possibly hinting at the inclusion of Self-Revives lives and Shockwaves, before noting that March would see the launch of season 2 for chapter 7.

Fortnite‚Äôs Stability Was Also Addressed

After teasing fun updates, Timmins also revealed the creation of a ‚Äúmulti-discipline live-ops strike team.‚Äù This is a new addition to the development team, whose focus is on improving the player experience and general quality-of-life updates. He notes that this is a permanent addition to the development team.

The message concludes with a reminder to players that they can get a guaranteed Stick of Truth if they join this weekend‚Äôs Power Hour.

What updates do you think will be coming to Fortnite in February and March to spice up the game? Sound off in our official Discord server.

item.title: No Rest for the Wicked Dev Explains Eventual Price Increase
item.content:encoded:
No Rest for the Wicked is currently an action role-playing game in Early Access. Moon Studios, known for the Ori series, plans to increase the game‚Äôs price from $40 to $60 after it leaves Steam Early Access and launches version 1.0.

The game is currently on sale at 40% off. Thomas Mahler, Creative Director of the game, tweeted to explain the sale and reiterate plans to move the game to $60 once it‚Äôs released in full.

‚ÄúI‚Äô‚Äôm not trying to do any FOMO marketing here, but yes: when we hit 1.0, No Rest for the Wicked will move to $60, because it‚Äôs a premium title,‚Äù he said.

Mahler Compares No Rest for the Wicked to Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3

Furthermore, he explained that the game launched in Early Access at $40 because he did not feel it was right to charge early supporters full price before it was properly ready.

He compared his strategy to that of Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3, which launched into Early Access at full price, explaining that he was never a fan of that approach.

‚ÄúBG3 launched into Early Access at full price, and personally, I never loved that approach. If you support a game early, you should get some extra love,‚Äù he‚Äôd add.

Those interested can currently pick up the game on Steam for $23.99.

item.title: Tomodachi Life Sequel Limits Image-Sharing, Expands Inclusivity
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo issues a statement on image-sharing features in Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream.

Nintendo recently held a dedicated Nintendo Direct for the upcoming Tomodachi Life sequel headed to the Nintendo Switch family of consoles. In addition to announcing the game‚Äôs April 16 release, the presentation showcased how players could customize their Miis and the island they inhabit.

However, Nintendo has issued a statement regarding limitations to image sharing in the upcoming game.

Nintendo Is Committed to Creating Experiences That Are Welcoming for Everyone

Following the Nintendo Direct, the official Nintendo blog issued a statement saying that restrictions have been placed on certain image-sharing features to create a safe environment for all players.

While these moments are often fun for players, we recognize that out-of-context scenes may be misunderstood or may not reflect the spirit in which the game is intended to be enjoyed.

Nintendo did, however, decide to expand players‚Äô ability to express their gender and sexuality through their Tomodachi Life Mii characters. Players can now choose to make characters non-binary and date anyone of any gender. This follows a 2014 statement promising that future efforts would aim to design a more inclusive gameplay experience after players questioned the omission of same-sex relationships in the original Tomodachi Life.

The trailer released on January 29 showed that certain characters will experience heartbreak multiple times in Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream, while others may find marriage after bonding over monster trucks. Truly different strokes for different folks.

For more on Nintendo, see the update to rumors about a February 2026 Nintendo Direct.

Sound off in our official Discord server about your feelings regarding the upcoming quirky life sim, and don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: WWE 2K26 Pricing Revealed For All Editions
item.content:encoded:
The prices for all four editions of WWE 2K26 have leaked ahead of the official start of pre-orders on January 30.

WWE 2K26 will be released in four versions, and according to a new report from billbil-kun of Dealabs, the prices for the upcoming game have been released. The Standard Edition, which includes only the base game, will be priced at $69.99. The King of Kings Edition, the second-tier ‚ÄúDeluxe‚Äù edition, will be priced at $99.99.

Then, the Attitude Era Edition, the ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù Edition of the game, will release for $129.99. Finally, the Monday Night War Edition will provide access to the most content throughout the game‚Äôs lifecycle and will be priced at $149.99.

In addition to providing players with more content at no additional cost, all higher-priced tiers will grant access to the game on March 6. Reportedly, this is 7 days earlier than when players who purchased only the standard tier will be able to play.

WWE 2K26 Leaves Last-Gen Consoles Behind

After years of the current WWE game line releasing on both PlayStation 4 and Xbox One, the ESRB rating for WWE 2K26 confirms that this year‚Äôs release will be limited to current-gen consoles.

Ironically, while WWE 2K26 leaves the past behind with its console releases, much of the game‚Äôs marketing has been rooted in WWE‚Äôs past. The Attitude Era and Monday Night War Editions focus heavily on the peak of WWE popularity in the late 90s and early 2000s.

Also, all three covers for the higher-priced tiers feature WWE Legends, with one legend in particular on all three covers: Triple H.

WWE 2K26‚Äôs Showcase Focuses on CM Punk

As first reported by Insider Gaming, this year‚Äôs 2K Showcase campaign focuses on CM Punk. Players will get to relive some of CM Punk‚Äôs greatest moments from his WWE career.

Also, fans can experience fantasy scenarios that may have occurred if CM Punk not left WWE in 2014 before returning in 2023. Learn more about that here.

item.title: Prime Video Casts Thor and Odin in God of War

As the Prime Video God of War series continues to take shape, two additional casting decisions have been announced. Deadline reports that the legendary Mandy Patinkin, known for playing Inigo Montoya in The Princess Bride, will be in the upcoming series playing Odin. Odin is known as the ‚ÄúAll-Father.‚Äù The Ruler of the Norse Pantheon is also the father of Thor and Heimdall. It was previously confirmed that Max Parker will play Heimdall. However, we now know who will play Thor.

√ìlafur Darri √ìlafsson, known for his role as the stern and violent, when necessary, Mr. Drummond on the Apple TV series Severance, will portray the God of Thunder, according to Deadline. Furthermore, the series will portray Thor as a former soldier of Asgard and Odin‚Äôs former right-hand man. He is dealing with some confidence issues and is struggling with alcohol as a means of coping.

Ryan Hurst, the series‚Äô Kratos, previously voiced Thor in the God of War: Ragnar√∂k video game. It has also been confirmed that Teresa Palmer will play Thor‚Äôs wife, Sif, in the series.

Prime Video‚Äôs God of War is Already Renewed for Season 2

Without even having filmed a single episode, Amazon renewed the series for a second season. Production is expected to begin in February 2026. The first two episodes are to be directed by Frederick E. O. Toye, who previously directed the video game‚Äìto‚ÄìTV adaptation Fallout.

item.title: New Backyard Baseball Game Coming This Summer
item.content:encoded:
Get ready to kid the kids to the vacant lot. A new Backyard Baseball game is coming this year.

Playground Productions has officially announced a new Backyard Baseball game will launch in Summer 2026. It‚Äôs the first new game in the Backyard Sports series since Backyard Sports Baseball 2015 for iOS and Android. With a likely release for console, it would be the first for major platforms since Backyard Sports: Rookie Rush in 2010.

Details on the game itself weren‚Äôt revealed, but Playground Productions says that information will come in the near future.

To hold over until more news comes, Playground has released Backyard Sports: The Animated Special on YouTube. The nearly 12-minute show features an all-star cast of Christopher Mintz-Plasse, Ego Nwodim, Donald Faison, Adam Pally, and more.

‚ÄúIn a high-energy new animated special from Playground Productions, the beloved 90‚Äôs video game franchise ‚ÄúBackyard Sports‚Äù returns as superstar Stephanie ‚ÄúBubbles‚Äù Morgan is in crisis after losing her gotta-have-it, never-play-without-it lucky bubble gum,‚Äù the show‚Äôs description reads. ‚ÄúWith just 30 minutes until game time, the Backyard kids embark on a wild, time-sensitive mission to track it down and save their season.‚Äù
